abstract: Manhattan's residential real estate includes about 100 buildings, mostly co-ops, that are built on leased land; units in these buildings tend to cost less, and monthly common charges do not include real estate taxes; rental payments for the land, however are part of monthly fees, and sharp rise in land prices has some co-op apartment owners worried about potential for a correspondingly hefty hike in their payments.
lead_paragraph: Land-lease buildings in New York rent the ground on which they stand. With land prices soaring, unit owners in these buildings worry that their costs will rise.

headline.main: Rising Costs a Concern for Land-Lease Building Owners
headline.print_headline: Tied to the Land in the City

snippet: Land-lease buildings in New York rent the ground on which they stand. With land prices soaring, unit owners in these buildings worry that their costs will rise.
